Tech Department

As a fairly new high school, Legend is up-to-date on the latest technology in the classroom. However, with great power comes great responsibility. Students at Legend High School have the privelege to work with some of the best educators from across the country. Bearing industry experience, an eye for design, and an engineering mindset.

Legend High School features an in depth and challenging courseload. With classes built on the ideas of self motivation, industry standards, and excellence, students are expected to produce some of their best work. Below is an in depth flowchart of all CTE courses offered at Legend High School.

Engineering

Pathway

Intro to Engineering

An introductory course that explores the engineering profession.
Mr. Watterson
eewatterson@dcsdk12.org

↓

Engineering I

Students work individually or collaboratively to design, simulate, build, and evaluate a variety of practical problem solving challenges.
Mr. Watterson
eewatterson@dcsdk12.org

↓

Engineering II - Robotics

Students work individually or collaboratively to find a solution to a practical problem involving robotics.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

↓

Engineering III

Students identify a problem, develop a solution, and complete an individual engineering capstone project.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

↓

Engineering IV

Students identify a problem, develop a solution, and complete a team engineering capstone project.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

↓

Project Management

Introduces students to planning, implementation, and control activities of project management.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

Alternatives

CAD 255 - SolidWorks

Advanced design students use CAD tools for engineering design, documentation, simulation, and sustainable design of practical problem based challenges.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

Architectural Drafting

Students work individually or collaboratively to design, simulate, build, and evaluate a variety of practical problem solving challenges.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

Computer Science

Programming Pathway

Intro to Mobile App Design
(Optional)

A project-oriented course that examines the principles of mobile application design and development.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

↓

Intro to Programming

Emphasizes the design and implementation of structures and logically correct programs with good documentation.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

↓

Java I

Introduces students to the discipline of computer science including algorithm development, data representation, logical expressions, sub-programs, and input/output operators.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

↓

AP Computer Science

Emphasizes object-oriented programming methodology with a concentration on problem solving and algorithm development.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

Game Design Pathway

Game Design

Learn the programming basics needed to create various types of games.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

↓

Advanced Game Design

Introduces computer program design using concepts to structure programming and logic.
Mr. Stasiak
dstasiak@dcsdk12.org

Marketing

Business Pathway

Business Management

A project-oriented class to help students understand the basic elements and aspects of the business world.
Mr. Ramos
ricardo.ramos@dcsdk12.org

↓

Personal Finance

Designed to show students personal finance needs of the individual.
Mr. Ramos
ricardo.ramos@dcsdk12.org

↓

Intro to Business

Focuses on the operation of the American business system and covers the economy, careers, marketing, management and other aspects of business.
Mr. Ramos
ricardo.ramos@dcsdk12.org

↓

Social Media Business

Looks toward how social media can help a business owner promote their business and products.
Mr. Ramos
ricardo.ramos@dcsdk12.org

Marketing Pathway

Entrepreneurship

Focuses on the rigors of creating and maintaining a business.
Mr. Farley
sfarley@dcsdk12.org

↓

Marketing I

Introductory course to show how marketing adds values to products.
Mr. Farley
sfarley@dcsdk12.org

↓

Marketing II

Delves into the marketing prices techniques and market research.
Mr. Farley
sfarley@dcsdk12.org

↓

Sports Marketing

An in depth class devoted toward sports teams, athletes, and how to market to fans.
Mr. Farley
sfarley@dcsdk12.org

Design

Technical

Intro to Multimedia

A course focused on the history and impact of Multimedia tools on society and how they are used in the workplace and classroom.
Mrs. Manzanares
mkmanzanares@dcsdk12.org

Web Design

A web design course focused on planning, design, and creation of industry standard websites.
Mrs. Manzanares
mkmanzanares@dcsdk12.org

Digital Video Editing

Introduces students to non linear video editing. Students are expected to capture, compress, edit, and manipulate videos.
Mrs. Manzanares
mkmanzanares@dcsdk12.org

Media Internship

An independent study allowing students to pursue their interests for after high school.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

Design

Intro to Graphic Design

A graphic design course where students are expected to explore basic computer operations and utilize design software.
Mrs. Manzanares
mkmanzanares@dcsdk12.org

Graphic Design I

A course in which students can be more creative with their designs, and are expected to utilize Adobe Illustrator.
Mrs. Manzanares
mkmanzanares@dcsdk12.org

Adobe InDesign

Introduces students to Adobe InDesign, a page layout program which integrates seamlessly with other Adobe products.
Mrs. Tawzer
datawzer@dcsdk12.org

Motion Graphic Design

Allows students to explore the fundamental principles of motion graphics.
Mr. Watterson
eewatterson@dcsdk12.org

Computer Animation

Introduces students to the field of 3D computer animation using industry level software.
Mr. Watterson
eewatterson@dcsdk12.org
